entry.title: How I schedule posts using atd
entry.content: This blog is built with a static site generator. The generator, the markdown source files, and the generated HTML files are all kept together in the same git repository. Every time I commit a change, a pre-commit hook runs the generator and adds the generated HTML, so that the blog entries are always up to date. Then the changes are pushed up to GitHub.

entry.title: About this blog 2
entry.content: I touched briefly on the technology used in this blog in a previous post, but I didn't explain the motivation behind a lot of the choices I made when building it. I'd like to do that in this post. The design and architecture of this blog is the product of what things I like in other blogs, and also those things that I find frustrating. Where a choice was not obvious, I opted for the simplest option. The point of the exercise was to get it online. Below are a few points in no particular order.

entry.title: About this blog
entry.content: This blog took a long time to get started. Every time I tried to build it, I wound up focussed on some tech I wanted to use to host it. In the previous iteration, I even wrote a server framework. I took some holiday over the Christmas period, so I decided to throw everything away and make something minimal.
